result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M. Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
** Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
** Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
May not have contact with Any known drug users or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of DE's probation. Court approves transfer of probation to state of Illinois if approved by DOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M. Carter

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

9:23 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexander M. Carter in court with Attorney Chad A Shamali in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Matter is resolved and Attorney Shamali files the plea questionnaire in court. Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court. Both parties waive the request for a PSI; Court grants request. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions. No contact with any known drug users or drug dealers. Probation may be transferred to the state of Illinois if approved by DOC. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 1 day sentence credit if revoked. Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Defendant, Alexander M. Carter, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

150PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
